messages.title: END THE POSTCODE LOTTERY ON HEALTH

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Brexit Party's stance is that the NHS should remain publicly funded and free at the point of use, with additional investment.

issues.health: The leaflet expresses the Brexit Party's commitment to the NHS, suggesting that it should remain publicly funded and free at the point of use.

endorsements.endorsement: The NHS would remain publicly funded and free.
NHS investment will bring about the much-needed, ring-fenced mental health funding.
The Brexit Party backs the NHS, which should remain public and free at the point of use, with additional investment.
A local GP chief in Devizes constituency supports the Brexit Party's pledge to keep the NHS free at the point of use.
As a Qualified Nurse Manager, agrees with the Brexit Party's position on the NHS.
Support for the Brexit Party to keep the NHS well-funded and free at the point of use.

quotes.text: In victory, I would never be part of any political party that would sell the NHS – it is a vital British institution. The Brexit Party are in this alliance. The NHS must remain publicly funded and free at the point of service, with additional investment.
We have the opportunity to vote for a party that respects our brave servicemen and service women. A party that supporters our services such as the NHS with additional funding.

Get Brexit done – back the Brexit Party, which is the only political party that plans to honour your democratic decision of 2016 referendum and will make sure the NHS is well-funded and free at the point of use.

images.caption: END THE POSTCODE LOTTERY ON HEALTH
